Topics

  • Algebraic Geometry: Studying the zeros of a polynomial (for today anyway). How to do things exactly sometimes. At our level vaguely equal to commutate algebra.
  • Commutative Algebra: Study of things that look like polynomials
  • Polynomial: A polynomial is variables is a finite sum of terms. A term is an expression of the form such that .
  • Rings: : Integers, : Rational, : Real, Complex.
  • , polynomial ring, quantity of term and coefficient space. Share most properties other than multiplicative inverse.
  • Ring: A set is a ring if it has a additive and multiplicative identity, supports binary operation, the commutative property, distributive and associative property.
  • Field: A field is a ring that for all such that there exists a such that , . All poly rings are not fields.
  • Variety: For , .
    • Ex:

Questions

  1. When do two curves intersect
  2. What polynomials are zero on parametric curves? Implicitization.
  3. Given a zero set find a parametrization. Parametrization.

  1. Splines (FRC gang?)
  2. Automatic geometric theorem proving: robotics applications to determine facts of system.
